intro: Psychotria jasminoides, commonly known as the jasmine psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling jasmine. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture. Psychotria jasminoides is also noted for its use in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its aromatic properties.
